#importing libraries for data frame and visualization
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
%matplotlib inline
import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
source.ad22d834:
#first reading the train csv file 
titanic_data= pd.read_csv('../input/titanic/train.csv')
source.7c555d95:
#more info about the dataset like datatypes & null_count
titanic_data.info()
source.6d784daf:
#to find the missing values in the column
titanic_data.isnull().sum()
source.6945d653:
#dropping the 'Cabin' column because it has number of null values
titanic_data= titanic_data.drop(columns='Cabin')
source.7dae32a0:
#now we are left with the age column...we will fill the age column by avg age of the passengers
titanic_data['Age'].fillna(titanic_data['Age'].mean(), inplace=True)
source.b478160e:
#age column is also now replaced with avg. age of the passengers
titanic_data.isnull().sum()
source.6d1b70cd:
#we are left with embarked column...we will replace the null values by most character used in it (C,Q,&S)
#To find the most characters used---> .mode()
print(titanic_data['Embarked'].mode())
source.3c3d7a48:
#now embarked column is replaced with value s
titanic_data.isnull().sum()
source.14a65300:
#viewing the statistical values like mean, count, max, min....
#only age & fare column does not come under the category column(limited value like 0&1)
titanic_data.describe()
source.14dd7714:
#finding the no. of passengers survived and not
titanic_data['Survived'].value_counts()
source.192ade3e:
#a count plot of 'Sex'...comparing the survivors based on the gender
sns.countplot('Sex',hue='Survived',data=titanic_data)
source.bc8208cd:
#making a countplot by comparing the survivors based on the pclass
sns.countplot('Pclass',hue='Survived',data=titanic_data)
source.2391f932:
#plotting the graph of no. of passengers vs age present in the titanic
plt.figure(figsize=(7,8))
plt.title("No.of passangers vs Age")
plt.hist((titanic_data["Age"]), color= ['r'])
plt.xlabel("age")
plt.ylabel("No.of passangers")
plt.show()
source.c943ee4c:
#to know the age  category of the Pclass
plt.figure(figsize=(12,8))
sns.boxplot(x='Pclass', y='Age', data= titanic_data,palette=('bright'))

#for creating the dataset for the submission
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

categories= ['Pclass','Sex','SibSp','Parch']
x= pd.get_dummies(titanic_data[categories])
test_x= pd.get_dummies(data_test[categories])
model= RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=5, random_state=1)
model.fit(x,y)
predictions=model.predict(test_x)
output= pd.DataFrame({'PassengerId': data_test.PassengerId,'Survived': predictions,'Name': data_test.Name,'Age': data_test.Age})
output.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
